options.content:
#### ðŸ›Žï¸ Important

This Dashboard is an experimental MongoDB Instance Summary dashboard in Percona Monitoring and Management (PMM) that is not a part of the official PMM deployment and might be updated.
We ship this Dashboard to obtain feedback from our users. Once we officially release this Dashboard, it will be moved to the appropriate folder. 

To provide feedback on the Dashboard, please use [our](https://forums.percona.com) forum.ðŸ™

panels.description: Ops or Replicated Ops/sec classified by legacy wire protocol type (query, insert, update, delete, getmore). And (from the internal TTL threads) the docs deletes/sec by TTL indexes.
panels.title: Command Operations

panels.description: Docs per second inserted, updated, deleted or returned. (N.b. not 1-to-1 with operation counts.)
panels.title: Document Operations

panels.description: Ratio of Documents returned or Index entries scanned / full documents scanned
panels.title: Query Efficiency

panels.description: Operations queued due to a lock.
panels.title: Queued Operations

panels.description: The parameter shows how long a system has been â€œupâ€ and running without a shut down or restart.

targets.expr: avg by (node_name)  (time() - container_start_time_seconds{node_name=~"$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}) or avg by (node_name) ((node_time_seconds{node_name=~"$node_name"} - node_boot_time_seconds{node_name=~"$node_name"}) or (time() - node_boot_time_seconds{node_name=~"$node_name"}))

panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: Sum of disk space on all partitions. Note  it can be significantly over-reported in some installations

targets.expr:
avg by () (container_fs_limit_bytes{node_name=~"$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}) or 
avg by () (sum(avg(node_filesystem_size_bytes{node_name=~"$node_name",fstype=~"(ext.|xfs|vfat|)"}) without (mountpoint)) without (device,fstype))

panels.title: Disk Space

panels.description: RAM (Random Access Memory) is the hardware in a computing device where the operating system, application programs and data in current use are kept so they can be quickly reached by the device's processor.
panels.title: RAM

panels.description: Lowest percent of the disk space available
panels.title: Min Space Available

panels.description: This panel shows the number of objects (both data (scanned_objects) and index (scanned)) as well as the number of documents that were moved to a new location due to the size of the document growing. Moved documents only apply to the MMAPv1 storage engine.
panels.title: Scanned and Moved Objects

panels.description:
Percent of Memory Available
Note: on Modern Linux Kernels amount of Memory Available for application is not the same as Free+Cached+Buffers

targets.expr:
clamp_max(avg by () (container_memory_usage_bytes{node_name=~"$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|backup-agent|"} * 100 / container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|backup-agent|"}),100) or  
avg by () (((node_memory_MemAvailable_bytes{node_name=~"$node_name"} or (node_memory_MemFree_bytes{node_name=~"$node_name"} + node_memory_Buffers_bytes{node_name=~"$node_name"} + node_memory_Cached_bytes{node_name=~"$node_name"})) / node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{node_name=~"$node_name"}) * 100 or (100 - azure_memory_percent_average{node_name=~"$node_name"}))

panels.title: Memory Available

panels.description: Show the 5 collections that are most frequently read.
panels.title: Top 5 Hottest Collections by Read (Rate)

targets.expr:
avg by (service_name, conn_type) (mongodb_mongod_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"} or
mongodb_mongos_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"} or
mongodb_ss_connections{service_name=~"$service_name"})

panels.description: Timespan 'window' between newest and the oldest op in the Oplog collection.
panels.title: Oplog Recovery Window - $service_name

panels.description: Average latency of operations (classified by read, write, or (other) command)
panels.title: Latency Detail

panels.description: The CPU time is measured in clock ticks or seconds. It is useful to measure CPU time as a percentage of the CPU's capacity, which is called the CPU usage.

targets.expr: avg by (node_name,mode) (clamp_max(((avg by (mode) ( (clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode!="idle", mode!="user", mode!="system"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode!="idle", mode!="user", mode!="system"}[5m]),1)) ))*100 or (avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode!="total", mode!="idle", mode!="user", mode!="system"}[$interval]) or avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode!="total", mode!="idle", mode!="user", mode!="system"}[5m]))),100))

clamp_max(sum(rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval]) or rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[5m])) or
max by () (sum  by (cpu) ( (clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode!="idle",mode!="iowait"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode!="idle",mode!="iowait"}[5m]),1)) )),1)

clamp_max(avg(rate(container_cpu_system_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval])) or 
((avg by () ((clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode="system"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode="system"}[5m]),1)) ))*100 or 
(avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode="system"}[$interval]) or 
avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode="system"}[5m]))),100)

clamp_max(avg(rate(container_cpu_user_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval])) or 
((avg by () ((clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode="user"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode="user"}[5m]),1)) ))*100 or 
(avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode="user"}[$interval]) or 
avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode="user"}[5m]))),100)

panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: When a system is running with maximum CPU utilization, the transmitting and receiving threads must all share the available CPU. This will cause data to be queued more frequently to cope with the lack of CPU. CPU Saturation may be measured as the length of a wait queue, or the time spent waiting on the queue.

targets.expr:
((sum(avg_over_time(container_processes{node_name=~"$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval]))-1) / avg by () (machine_cpu_cores)) or
avg by () ((avg_over_time(node_procs_running{node_name=~"$node_name"}[$interval])-1) / scalar(count(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="user", node_name=~"$node_name"})) or (avg_over_time(node_procs_running{node_name=~"$node_name"}[5m])-1) / scalar(count(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="user", node_name=~"$node_name"})))

clamp_max(sum(rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval]) or rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[5m])) or
max by () (sum  by (cpu) ( (clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode!="idle",mode!="iowait"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode!="idle",mode!="iowait"}[5m]),1)) )),1)

panels.title: CPU Saturation and Max Core Usage

panels.description: Average latency of operations (classified by read, write, or (other) command)
panels.title: Flow Control

panels.description:
Disk I/O includes read or write or input/output operations involving a physical disk. It is the speed with which the data transfer takes place between the hard disk drive and RAM.

Swap Activity is memory management that involves swapping sections of memory to and from physical storage.

targets.expr:
avg by () (sum(rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]) or irate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]))) or
avg by () (rate(node_vmstat_pgpgin{node_name="$node_name"}[$interval]) * 1024 or irate(node_vmstat_pgpgin{node_name="$node_name"}[5m]) * 1024)

avg by () (sum(rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]) or irate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]))) or
avg by () ((rate(node_vmstat_pgpgout{node_name="$node_name"}[$interval]) * 1024 or irate(node_vmstat_pgpgout{node_name="$node_name"}[5m]) * 1024))

avg by () (sum(rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]) or irate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]))) + 
avg by () (sum(rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]) or irate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]))) or 
avg  by () ((rate(node_vmstat_pgpgin{node_name="$node_name"}[$interval]) * 1024 or irate(node_vmstat_pgpgin{node_name="$node_name"}[5m]) * 1024 ) + (rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]) or irate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]))) + 
avg by () (sum(rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]) or irate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]))) or 
avg  by () ((rate(node_vmstat_pgpgout{node_name="$node_name"}[$interval]) * 1024 or irate(node_vmstat_pgpgout{node_name="$node_name"}[5m]) * 1024))

avg by () (rate(container_memory_swap{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval]) or 
irate(container_memory_swap{node_name="$node_name",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[5s])) or 
avg by () (rate(node_vmstat_pswpout{node_name="$node_name"}[$interval]) * 4096 or 
irate(node_vmstat_pswpout{node_name="$node_name"}[5m]) * 4096)

panels.title: Disk I/O and Swap Activity
